definition: to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
disaster/misfortune/calamity
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck

sentences.english: People would be framed for bombings they did not commit; planes would be hijacked.
sentences.chinese: 人們將爆炸事件嫁禍於他們沒有犯，飛機將被劫持。

sentences.english: It sounds like you’re just looking for someone to get mad at other than yourself.
sentences.chinese: 聽起來更像是你在嫁禍他人“。

sentences.english: Did Jin-tae do it and plant the evidence?
sentences.chinese: 是金泰乾的然後嫁禍於他？

sentences.english: It's your fault. How can you shift the blame onto someone else?
sentences.chinese: 這是你自己的錯，怎麼能嫁禍於人？

sentences.english: He had stolen the report and then tried to frame Rhys with it.
sentences.chinese: 他偷走了報告，還企圖嫁禍於里斯。

definition: to slander/to smear/to vilify
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to bawl out/to reprimand severely
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
traitor
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to seize power
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to take a concubine
to contradict (elders or superiors)
